title: Airdrop
description: Distributing tokens to a designated group of recipients based on certain qualifying criteria.

title: All-pay Auction
description: Competitive bidding process where all participants pay their bids, regardless of whether they win or lose. The highest bidder wins the item, but everyone else loses their bid money.

title: Approval Voting
description: A voting mechanism that allows voters to express approval for multiple options simultaneously. The winner is the option with the highest number of approvals.

title: Assurance Contract
description: Participants pledge money to fund a project. If the funding goal is met by a specified deadline, the pledges are collected and the good is provided. If the project fails to reach its funding goal, participants receive a refund.

title: Automated Market-Maker (AMM)
description: Decentralized exchange mechanism that employs a mathematical algorithm, known as a bonding curve, to establish the price of an asset in response to market supply and demand dynamics.

title: Batch Auction
description: Groups individual orders and executes them simultaneously at a uniform clearing price.

title: Bounty
description: A pre-specified task and reward for anyone who completes a specific task or achieving within a particular ecosystem.

title: Burn-and-Mint Equilibrium (BME)
description: Users burn tokens to access network services, reducing the token supply, while service providers receive new tokens minted at a controlled but independent rate.

title: Buyback & Burn
description: A financial mechanism aimed at increasing the value of a token by repurchasing it from the open market and then permanently removing it from circulation through burning.

title: Buyback & Make
description: A financial mechanism aimed at increasing the utility and value of a token within a decentralized network by repurchasing tokens and allocating them to productive use.

title: Capped Returns
description: A mechanism where the returns on an investment are limited to a certain percentage or amount.

title: Coin Machine
description: Sells limited amounts of tokens in fixed-price batches, adjusting prices up or down in between sale periods based on recent demand.

title: Collateralized Debt Position (CDP)
description: Locking up collateral in one token to take out a loan worth less in a different token. The loan must be paid back to unlock the collateral. The loan can be liquidated if the value of the collateral drops below the value of the loan (or comes close enough).

title: Competitive Vote-Based Issuance
description: Contributors submit proposals or content, and token holders within the community cast votes to determine which contributors receive the new token issuance.

title: Conditional Token
description: Can be redeemed at a particular value based on the outcome of specific conditions or events.

title: Continuous Auction
description: Repeating auction to sell newly created NFTs from collection on a recurring basis. The highest bidder receives the NFT, and all proceeds go to a treasury that is governed by the NFT holders. Auctions can occur at any chosen interval, with a common default being daily.

title: Contract Secured Revenue (CSR)
description: Allows contract creators to receive a portion of the gas fees consumed by their contracts within a given block.

title: Conviction Voting
description: Proposals are passed based on aggregated continuous preferences of community members.

title: Correlation Discount
description: Reducing the weight of correlated opinions to mitigate the overrepresentation of popular views and balance the influence across different voter segments. By recognizing and adjusting for the correlation among voters' preferences, this mechanism aims to enhance the fairness and representativeness of collective decisions.

title: Crowdfund
description: Collecting funds without necessarily issuing a token in exchange.

title: Crowdsale
description: Raising funds for a project by issuing new tokens to purchasers. These tokens can represent a mix of rights including governance, economic, or access to a product or service.

title: Curation Markets
description: Reduce information asymmetry through the use of tokenized signals. Tokens are minted as needed through a continuous token model.

title: DAICO
description: Allows token holders to control the gradual release of funds to a project after fundraising.

title: DAO Options
description: Tokenized options that give the holder the right to buy or sell tokens in the DAO. Can be used for an airdrop, as liquidity incentives, or to motivate contributors.

title: Decentralized Identifier (DID)
description: Unique identifiers that allow entities to be identified in a verifiable and persistent way without relying on a centralized registry. They can be used to identify entities such as persons, organizations, or Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

title: Delegated Allocation
description: Giving individual allocators budgets and discretion to support projects and people they believe in.

title: Demurrage
description: A negative interest rate applied to currency or tokens held in a particular ecosystem, incentivizing spending and discouraging hoarding.

title: Dispute Resolution Game
description: Jurors vote on the outcome of disputes, and the majority decision is considered the final verdict. Honest jurors are rewarded, and dishonest jurors are penalized, reinforcing the integrity of the system.

title: Dividend
description: A portion of profits or revenue distributed to token holders.

title: Dominant Assurance Contract (DAC)
description: Participants pledge money to fund a project. If the funding goal is met by a specified deadline, the pledges are collected and the good is provided. If the project fails to reach its funding goal, participants receive a monetary bonus in addition to a refund.

title: Dutch Auction
description: An auction where the price of an asset starts high and gradually decreases over time.

title: Dynamic Parameter Tuning
description: Adjusts system parameters in real-time based on predefined criteria to optimize system performance or meet specific objectives.

title: Escrow
description: A mechanism where funds or tokens are held in a neutral account until certain conditions are met.

title: Fair Ranking
description: Adaption of token curated registries (TCRs) where information which ranks highly is provably valuable to network stakeholders.

title: First-Price Auction
description: An auction, typically with a sealed-bid, in which the auction winner pays their bid (and nobody else pays).

title: Flash Loan
description: A type of loan that allows borrowers to borrow and repay funds within a single transaction, without the need for collateral.

title: Fractionalized NFT
description: An NFT divided into multiple pieces, allowing for fractional ownership of the original token.

title: Futarchy
description: Combines voting with prediction markets to decide which policies will best achieve success metrics.

title: Graduated Sanctions
description: Penalties that increase in severity based on the frequency or degree of rule-breaking.

title: Guild Kick
description: Process for removing a DAO member through a proposal that allows the removed member to redeem their funds based on the number of DAO units that the member was holding. Similar to Rage Quit but initialized through a proposal voted on by other members, rather than through unilateral action of the member themselves.

title: Harberger Tax
description: Harberger taxes are a form of taxation on private goods, such as houses, domain names, luxury cars, and NFTs, that incentivize owners to sell or rent unused assets.

title: Holographic Consensus
description: A governance mechanism that allows for local decisions that represent the interests of a global group.

title: Impact Certificates
description: A digital certificate that represents a measurable positive social or environmental impact. It can be traded, sold, or donated, allowing investors and philanthropists to support projects that align with their values and earn returns from the positive outcomes generated by these projects.

title: Incentivized Peer Review
description: A mechanism that rewards individuals for reviewing and validating particular content or products within a particular ecosystem.

title: Incentivized Voting
description: Financial incentives for individual voters and/or delegates to participate in governance.

title: Instant Governance
description: Token-holders stake on values for each governance parameter and the resulting value is adjusted in real-time based on the stake-weighted median.

title: Liquid Democracy
description: A hybrid system that allows participants to directly vote on issues or delegate their votes to trusted delegate.

title: Liquidity Bonds
description: Allows users to exchange liquidity pool (LP) tokens for discounted protocol tokens, usually with a lock-up.

title: Liquidity Bootstrapping Pool (LBP)
description: A mechanism that allows for the gradual release of a particular token into a liquidity pool, allowing for price discovery and the creation of a market.

title: Liquidity Mining
description: Rewarding users who provide liquidity to particular token pools.

title: Lottery
description: Awarding prizes to randomly selected participants.

title: Minimum Anti-Collusion Infrastructure
description: Minimum Anti-Collusion Infrastructure (MACI) is a solution that uses zero-knowledge proofs to make blockchain voting, such as quadratic funding mechanisms, resistant to bribery and collusion.

title: Multisend
description: Sending tokens to multiple recipients in a single transaction.

title: Multistakeholder Governance
description: Representing the distinct interests of different stakeholders in the governance mechanics of a given system. This approach aims to incorporate a diverse range of perspectives, ensuring a more inclusive and resilient decision-making process.

title: Mutual Credit
description: Credit that members can issue to each other based on mutual trust, rather than using traditional forms of collateral.

title: Mutual Insurance
description: A cooperative insurance model where members pool resources to provide coverage against losses.

title: NFT
description: A unique and indivisible token that represents digital ownership.

title: NFT Drop
description: A method of distributing non-fungible tokens (NFTs) through a random or selective process.

title: Non-Transferable NFT
description: A non-transferable, non-fungible token (NFT), typically used to represent a digital badge or achievement within a particular context.

title: Non-Transferable Token
description: A non-transferable, fungible token, typically used to represent a user's reputation within a particular context.

title: Optimistic Governance
description: Proposals default to passing unless there is enough resistance. Participants vote against the options they dislike, rather than for the options they prefer.

title: Oracle
description: Information source that provides external data to smart contracts, bridging the gap between on-chain and off-chain systems.

title: Osmotic Funding
description: Voters signal budgeting preferences by staking tokens on projects. The rate at which each project is funded is determined by the staked amount and the available funds. The rate variations are smoothed over time to avoid high rate variations and offer stability to the projects.

title: Over-the-Counter (OTC) Transaction
description: Direct exchange of assets between two parties without using a public exchange.

title: Pairwise
description: A budgeting process where options are presented in pairs, and participants choose their preferred option from each pair. The formula distributes funding by computing the preferences over all pairwise comparisons.

title: Pass/Fail Voting
description: A simple binary voting system where participants can only choose between "yes" or "no".

title: Patronage-Based Token Earnings
description: A mechanism where token holders earn rewards in proportion to their usage of a platform or provision of service to the platform.

title: Payment Splitter
description: Divides incoming payments among multiple recipients according to hardcoded or dynamic ownership percentages.

title: Personhood
description: Related to SSI/DID but with emphasis on sybil resistance. This mechanism aims to prevent any one human from having multiple identities.

title: Points
description: Measures individual contributions or participation and allocates rewards proportionally to the systems’ overall contributions over a defined period, after which they can be converted to tangible rewards.

title: Prediction Market
description: Allow users to trade on future event outcomes, using market prices to reflect each outcome's probability. Participants stake tokens on their predictions, and markets are resolved when event outcomes are verified.

title: Private Voting
description: A form of voting that allows participants to keep their votes private, providing a layer of anonymity.

title: Proposal Inverter
description: Proposal can receive funding from multiple sources rather than just one.

title: Protection Market
description: Insures against losses from holding specific assets or using particular protocols by charging a fee proportional to the risk and amount being protected.

title: Protocol Owned Liquidity
description: Liquidity Pool tokens owned by the protocol itself. This allows the protocol to provide a floor of liquidity for its protocol while also allowing it to capture some of the transaction fees from the liquidity pool.

title: Quadratic Attention Payments
description: An advertising mechanism that uses quadratic voting to enhance ad relevance, user engagement, and revenue distribution among stakeholders.

title: Quadratic Funding
description: Quadratic funding is a donation-matching scheme that prioritizes projects based on the number of people who contributed rather than just the amount contributed. The share of the matching pool that each project receives is based on the square root of each contribution. This reduces the power of large donors to influence the matching of funds.

title: Quadratic Voting
description: A voting mechanism where participants can allocate a limited number of voting "points" to different options, with the number of points allocated being proportional to the square root of the number of points.

title: Quest
description: A gamified process where participants are incentivized to complete tasks or solve problems.

title: Quorum
description: Minimum level of participation required for a decision to be valid

title: Rage Quit
description: Participants can withdraw their stake or membership if they disagree with a decision made by the group.

title: Ranked Choice Voting
description: A voting system where participants rank the available options in order of preference.

title: Rebase Token
description: A monetary policy where the supply of tokens is adjusted automatically based on market conditions.

title: Redeemable NFT
description: NFT that is redeemable for a discrete good.

title: Referral Incentives
description: A mechanism where participants earn rewards for bringing in new users.

title: Rentable NFT
description: An NFT that can be rented out to others for a fee.

title: Research Object
description: A digital object that encapsulates data, code, and other assets related to a specific research project.

title: Reversible ICO
description: Token sale in which committed funds are used to buy tokens gradually, giving individual purchasers the possibility of partially reversing their purchase within a fixed time window.

title: Royalty Fee
description: Creator earns a percentage of revenue for each subsequent transaction involving their work.

title: Shareable NFT
description: A non-fungible token (NFT) that can be shared or split among multiple users.

title: Single Choice Voting
description: A simple voting system in which participants choose one option from a list of choices.

title: Slashing
description: A punitive measure where a network participant loses a portion or all of their staked assets for not adhering to the protocol rules.

title: Smart Property
description: Using smart contracts to manage the ownership and control of physical assets.

title: Social Graph
description: A graphical representation of individuals and their relationships

title: Sortition
description: A process where a randomly selected group of individuals make a decision on a dispute or issue. Selection probability could be equal for every participant or weighted by a number of different factors, such as tokens staked or square root of tokens staked.

title: Stakedrop
description: A method for distributing tokens to participants who commit and "lock up" their existing tokens for a specified period. It serves as a means to bootstrap a network, incentivize early adopters, and secure initial funding for a project.

title: Staking Gauges
description: Directing incentives towards different options based on token weighted staking

title: Streaming Auction
description: An auction mechanism that allows participants to bid on an item over a set period of time.

title: Subscription Fee
description: Users pay a recurring fee in exchange for access to a service or content.

title: Subsidized Voting
description: A system in which the transaction cost of voting is automatically covered by the organization.

title: Swapper
description: Swaps all incoming tokens into a desired output token.

title: Time-Based Booster
description: Staked tokens accumulate boosts over time which award them more rewards and/or governance rights. Boosts are reset whenever tokens are unstaked or transferred.

title: Time-Bound Funding Round
description: Participants submit proposals within a fixed time period for a fixed amount of capital, which is distributed among top winners based on the voting outcome.

title: Time-bound NFT
description: An NFT that is only valid during a particular time period, and expires after that time.

title: Time-Delay Execution
description: A mechanism that imposes a delay on certain actions to prevent spam, fraud or attacks.

title: Time-Weighted Average Market-Maker (TWAMM)
description: Automated market maker (AMM) that uses time-based weightings to price assets.

title: Time-Weighted Average Price (TWAP)
description: Pricing algorithm that calculates the average price of an asset over a set period of time.

title: Token Abstracted Voting
description: Vote with tokens that are in liquidity pool tokens or being lent to a pool, or are on a different chain.

title: Token Bonding Curve
description: Issues tokens according to an algorithmic price curve as a function of circulating supply, where token price increases as tokens are purchased on the curve and decreases as tokens are sold back to the curve.

title: Token Curated Registry (TCR)
description: A registry that is curated by token holders who are incentivized to maintain its integrity.

title: Token Gate
description: Restricting access to certain services, features or content based on token holdings.

title: Token Inflation
description: Issuing new supply of a token to to incentivize a particular set of behaviors.

title: Token Stream
description: Continuous transfer of tokens from a sender's account to a receiver's account.

title: Token Timelock
description: A mechanism that locks tokens for a set period of time to prevent them from being transferred or sold.

title: Token Vesting
description: A mechanism that releases tokens over a predetermined period, often used to incentivize team members or early investors.

title: Token-Weighted Voting
description: Assigning voting power based on the number of tokens held by each participant.

title: Tokenized Vault
description: Receipt tokens represent a claim on an underlying pool of tokens that grows with fees being generated.

title: Transaction Fee
description: A fee charged for transactions that occur within a particular marketplace or ecosystem, such as a purchase of NFTs.

title: Transferable Token
description: A token that can be freely traded or transferred between accounts.

title: Tribute
description: A proposal to contribute funds, often in exchange for a native token. Funds are held in escrow until the proposal passes and are returned to the proposer if if fails.

title: Universal Basic Income (UBI)
description: Provides all participants in a network with a basic income.

title: Variable Rate Gradual Dutch Auction (VRGDA)
description: Novel token issuance mechanism designed for Art Gobblers and used in 0xMonaco that allows for the sale of tokens close to a custom schedule over time by raising prices when sales are ahead of schedule and lowering prices when sales are behind schedule.

title: ve(3,3)
description: Variation of the veToken model that provides dilution protection and flexibility to token lockers.

title: Verifiable Credential (VC)
description: A digital credential that can be used to verify the identity or qualifications of an individual or organization.

title: Veto
description: The ability of certain participants to reject a proposed action.

title: veToken
description: "Vote Escrowed" tokens are non-transferable tokens generated by locking up the original token. The longer tokens are locked, the more veToken are generated. veTokens usually represent a share of voting power and profits of a system.

title: Vickrey Auction
description: Bidders submit written bids without knowing the bid of the other people in the auction. The highest bidder wins but the price paid is the second-highest bid.

title: Vote Decay
description: Stake weighting that decays according to certain factors, such as automatically over time or from not participating in governance.

title: Vote Delegation
description: Any address can delegate its voting rights to any other address, allowing them to vote on their behalf.

title: Wait for Quiet Voting
description: Wait until voting has quited down before closing a vote.

title: Web of Trust (WoT)
description: Mechanism for establishing and managing trust relationships among entities in a peer-to-peer network based on the endorsements and validations of others within the network.

title: Weighted Voting
description: A type of voting where voters can distribute voting points among different options, allowing them to indicate their level of preference.

title: Work Token
description: Service providers stake the network's native token to gain the opportunity to work for the network. The more tokens a provider stakes, the higher their chances of getting the next job, relative to the total tokens staked by all providers.

title: xToken
description: Receipt token that earns yield based on profit-share from fees.

title: Yield Delegation
description: Pooling tokens in order to donate the yield to a third-party.
